titlepage.titleproper: Register of the William La Varre Papers
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Memoirs, letters, memoranda, clippings, periodical issues, lists, notes, and financial records, relating to political development in Latin America, especially in the 1930's; United States relations with Latin America, 1933- 1945; the American Mercury; international communist subversion; and international affairs.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William La Varre Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1977.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Educated, Townsend Harris Hall, New York, Columbia University Extension, Harvard College (special student).
Chief, American Republics Units, U.S. State Department.

scopecontent.p: Biographical data relating to the career of William LaVarre, arranged alphabetically by subject.
Printed copies of newspaper and magazine articles by William LaVarre as well as typescripts of his autobiographical writings, arranged chronologically.
Correspondence, pamphlets, and printed material by others, including records of the American Mercury, arranged alphabetically by subject.
A file of the American Mercury Magazine and address lists of subscribers, filed chronologically.

did.unittitle: Appointment, Chief of the American Republics Unit, Department of Commerce, 1941. Newspaper clippings.
Interview with William LaVarre, Boston Transcript, February 18, 1922. Photocopies.
Publicity for lectures and articles by William LaVarre. Printed copies, 1937-1940.
